entries.title: Netflix Shareholders Vote to Recommend Refreshed Executive-Pay Plan
entries.description: Less than 30% of the company’s shareholders voted in favor of last year’s compensation package. Thursday’s vote is nonbinding.

entries.title: A Pretty Pink Cocktail and the Fierce Female Bartending Competition That Produced It
entries.description: It took a little friendly competition and a willingness to play to produce this remarkably refreshing tequila drink. It’s exactly what the Speed Rack community of female bartenders around the world does best.

entries.title: Australia Shares Set to Rise Despite Weak Lead
entries.description: Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 looks set to rise at the open despite softness in U.S. indices amid a pullback in tech stocks.

entries.title: Bankrupt MMA Law Firm Gets Creditors' Lawyers Disqualified
entries.description: Judge rules that a lawyer’s communications with MMA as a prospective client could be used against the bankrupt insurance-law firm.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia Set to Raise More Than $11.2 Billion From Aramco Stock Offering
entries.description: The kingdom is expected to price shares at $7.27 each, toward the lower end of the targeted range.

entries.title: HF Foods Settles Fraud Charges With SEC, to Pay $3.9 Million Fine
entries.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission said it had settled fraud charges against food-distributor HF Foods related to a former executive buying luxury cars.

entries.title: How Electric Vehicles Can Make Everyone Happy
entries.description: Ending subsidies, mandates and tariffs would expand use of EVs while letting people continue driving the cars they want.

entries.title: Wall Street Moves to Texas
entries.description: Financial firms want competition for the NYSE and Nasdaq.

entries.title: Two Censures for the Regime in Iran
entries.description: One comes from the International Atomic Energy Agency. The other comes from the Iranian people.

entries.title: The Academic Proletariat Goes on Strike at the University of California
entries.description: Workers of the faculty world unite in solidarity with anti-Israel protesters.

entries.title: The ECB's Leap Ahead of the Federal Reserve
entries.description: Lagarde bets that inflation will continue to fall in Europe.

entries.title: Firm Retention Summary: Express
entries.description: This is a summary of a request from the Official Committee of Unsecured Creditors of Express to hire Kramer Levin Naftalis & Frankel as co-counsel, filed June 5 with the U.S. Bankruptcy Court in Delaware.

entries.title: British Entrepreneur Mike Lynch Acquitted in HP Case
entries.description: Hewlett-Packard paid more than $11 billion for Autonomy in 2011, but a year later said its financial statements were inflated.

entries.title: Hallie Biden Recalls Discovery of Hunter's Gun in Wrenching Testimony: 'I Panicked.'
entries.description: Prosecutors have called a string of witnesses to speak about Hunter Biden’s addiction and drug-fueled partying.

entries.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.2% to 99.07
entries.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was down 0.2% to 99.07 — down for four of the past six trading days.

entries.title: Reagan at Pointe du Hoc, 40 Years Later
entries.description: June 1984 was a tense and dangerous time in the Cold War, but domestic politics were sweeter than today.

entries.title: Foreign Exchange, the Job the Federal Reserve Won't Do
entries.description: We’d all benefit from more policy coordination among central banks to stabilize currency markets.

entries.title: Shore Up the Social Safety Net With 'Predistribution'
entries.description: Such policies include raising the minimum wage, encouraging unions and fighting monopsony.

entries.title: Notable & Quotable: Mitch McConnell on Supreme Court Ethics
entries.description: ‘Recusal is a judicial act. These senators are telling the chief justice, privately, to change the course of pending litigation.’

entries.title: Dewey Defeats Biden
entries.description: Under the theory behind Alvin Bragg’s Trump verdict, FDR could have been tried for concealing his polio.
